intro: Pachycentria microsperma, commonly known as the small-seeded pachycentria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apocynaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
